intro: Dorycnium rectum f. glabrum, commonly known as the glabrous hogweed, is a variant of the common hogweed species. It is a biennial or perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features a stout, hairy stem that becomes glabrous (smooth) in this form. Its leaves are deeply lobed and can be quite large, often with a rough texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in umbels, and it produces a distinctive, swollen, club-shaped fruit.
